message: I normally use Eclipse for dev (Zend Studio) and was pleasantly surprised to find that many of the keyboard shortcuts work in App Builder. That's just awesome! (e.g. so far discovered: Cmd-D to delete a line, Alt-Up to move a line up, Alt-Cmd-Up to duplicate a line, select+tab to indent a block of code)
I am using eclipse too ( jseclipse)

just in case you don't know them already there are : 

Save: Ctrl + s
Fullscreen Toggle: Ctrl + enter
source code is here ( might not be up to date though) : https://github.com/kynetx/AppBuilder
the appbuilder is based on Ace ( which is now part of clou9ide)
I'd love to edit rulesets straight inside eclipse with KRL syntax highlighting and code completion , something that is available for komodo ( https://github.com/kynetx/KomodoforKRL )
but I think pushing the appbuilder inside cloud9ide would be even better. cloud9ide can run on a local environment and uses node.js
